definitions.definition: used to refer to a male object of a verb that is the same person or animal as the subject of the verb:
used to emphasize a particular man, boy, or male animal:
examples: Did you want to talk to the chairman himself, or could his personal assistant help you?

definitions.definition: If a man or boy does something by himself, he does it alone or without help from anyone else:
examples: Little Timmy made that snowman all by himself.
Johnny's got the apartment to himself next week.

definitions.definition: not to be, seem, or feel as happy or as healthy as usual:
examples: Is Tom all right? He doesn't seem quite himself this morning.

definitions.definition: used when describing or asking about a man's state of mind when he is physically ill:
examples: He's well enough in himself - he just can't shake this cold off.
